text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires explaining that the DUP opposed the new Northern Ireland Protocol because it implied customs checks in the Irish Sea. The candidate answer explicitly states: 'The Northern Ireland Protocol... subjected GB-NI trade to checks for \"goods at risk\" of entering the EU single market via Ireland. This created a \"sea border\" with routine customs/SPS (sanitary/phytosanitary) checks on GB-NI goods, which unionists (e.g., DUP) saw as partitioning the UK.' It further explains the DUP boycott context, confirming they rejected the Protocol for reasons directly related to the sea border/checks.", "criterion_id": "7f2d4371-c1ef-4b44-81d6-c18c43964231"}
